content.question: Which of the following accurately compares populism and fascism?

choices.label: Populism is the belief in the rights of the common people over those of the elites, while fascism is the belief in the rights of the ethnic majority over those of ethnic minorities.
Populism is a nationalist ideology that favors authoritarian rule, while fascism is an ideology that supports the reduction of income disparities.
Populism is in part the belief in the abolition of private property, while fascism is in part the belief in privatization to encourage economic growth.
Populism supports the rights and interests of individuals, while fascism supports the rights of political parties and the political opposition.

content.answer: Populism is the belief in the rights of the common people over those of the elites, while fascism is the belief in the rights of the ethnic majority over those of ethnic minorities.
